name: Fairy Glen
description: Series of pools and small falls in wooded gorge. Magical atmosphere. Slippery rocks require care. Can be busy on hot days.

name: Horseshoe Falls
description: Weir creates swimming pool on River Dee. Canal boats pass above on aqueduct. Historic setting near Llangollen. Can be strong current after rain.

name: Swallow Falls
description: Wales's most famous waterfall with pools above and below. Cold but refreshing. Busy viewing area but quieter swimming spots nearby.

name: Pistyll Rhaeadr
best_time: Highest waterfall in Wales (single drop). Pool at the bottom is swimmable but cold. Spectacular setting.

name: Aber Falls
description: Spectacular waterfall at the end of a valley walk. Shallow pools but great for a dip. Very popular.

name: Devil's Bridge Falls
best_time: Series of waterfalls and pools in a deep gorge. Famous bridges. Fee for entry to walk.

name: Cenarth Falls
best_time: Falls on the River Teifi. Famous for coracles and salmon. Pools below the falls.

name: Conwy Falls
best_time: Deep gorge on the River Conwy. Cafe nearby. Access can be tricky.

name: Melincourt Falls
description: Impressive 80ft waterfall in a nature reserve. Good pool for dipping.

name: Henrhyd Falls
description: Highest waterfall in South Wales. You can walk behind it (Batman cave). Plunge pool is cold but swimmable.

name: Watkin Path Pools
description: Series of crystal clear pools and waterfalls on the Watkin Path up Snowdon. Very popular in summer. Stunning blue water.

name: Sgwd Gwladus
description: Lady Falls. Elegant waterfall with a large plunge pool. Accessible walk from Pontneddfechan.

name: The Warren
description: Famous river beach on the Wye near Hay. Grassy bank, shingle beach. Popular with families.

name: Skenfrith Castle
description: Swim in the Monnow right next to a medieval castle. Grassy banks, popular picnic spot.

name: Wolf's Leap
description: Remote and spectacular gorge on the River Irfon. Deep pools and rocky steps. For experienced swimmers due to remoteness.
